verses.kjv: The burden of the desert of the sea. As whirlwinds in the south pass through; so it cometh from the desert, from a terrible land.
verses.web: The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it comes from the wilderness, from an awesome land.
verses.ct: A message about the desert by the sea: Like whirlwinds sweeping through the southern wilderness, it comes from the desert — from a terrifying land.

verses.kjv: A grievous vision is declared unto me; the treacherous dealer dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O Elam: besiege, O Media; all the sighing thereof have I made to cease.
verses.web: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media’s sighing.
verses.ct: A devastating vision has been shown to me: the traitor keeps betraying, and the destroyer keeps destroying. "Attack, Elam! Lay siege, Media!" God says, "I will put an end to all the groaning Babylon has caused."

verses.kjv: Therefore are my loins filled with pain: pangs have taken hold upon me, as the pangs of a woman that travaileth: I was bowed down at the hearing of it; I was dismayed at the seeing of it.
verses.web: Therefore my thighs are filled with anguish. Pains have seized me, like the pains of a woman in labor. I am in so much pain that I can’t hear. I so am dismayed that I can’t see.
verses.ct: Because of this, my body is racked with pain. Agony grips me like a woman in labor. What I've heard has left me reeling; what I've seen has filled me with horror.

verses.kjv: My heart panted, fearfulness affrighted me: the night of my pleasure hath he turned into fear unto me.
verses.web: My heart flutters. Horror has frightened me. The twilight that I desired has been turned into trembling for me.
verses.ct: My heart is pounding and terror overwhelms me. The peaceful evening I longed for has turned into a night of dread.

verses.kjv: Prepare the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye princes, and anoint the shield.
verses.web: They prepare the table. They set the watch. They eat. They drink. Rise up, you princes, oil the shield!
verses.ct: They spread the table, they post the guards, they eat and drink — then suddenly the cry goes up: "On your feet, commanders! Grab your shields and oil them for battle!"

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Go, set a watchman, let him declare what he seeth.
verses.web: For the Lord said to me, “Go, set a watchman. Let him declare what he sees.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Go and post a watchman. Have him report everything he sees."

verses.kjv: And he saw a chariot with a couple of horsemen, a chariot of asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearkened diligently with much heed:
verses.web: When he sees a troop, horsemen in pairs, a troop of donkeys, a troop of camels, he shall listen diligently with great attentiveness.”
verses.ct: "When he spots riders — pairs of horsemen, columns of donkeys, columns of camels — he must pay very close attention to what's coming."

verses.kjv: And he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continually upon the watchtower in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights:
verses.web: He cried like a lion: “Lord, I stand continually on the watchtower in the daytime, and every night I stay at my post.
verses.ct: The watchman cried out like a lion: "My lord, I've been standing at this watchtower all day long, and every night I've stayed at my post.

verses.kjv: And, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a couple of horsemen. And he answered and said, Babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the graven images of her gods he hath broken unto the ground.
verses.web: Behold, here comes a troop of men, horsemen in pairs.” He answered, “Fallen, fallen is Babylon; and all the engraved images of her gods are broken to the ground.
verses.ct: Look! Here comes a column of riders — horsemen in pairs!" Then he called out the news: "Babylon has fallen! Fallen! Every carved image of her gods has been smashed to the ground!"

verses.kjv: O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have heard of the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, have I declared unto you.
verses.web: You are my threshing, and the grain of my floor!” That which I have heard from LORD of Armies, the God of Israel, I have declared to you.
verses.ct: My people, you who have been crushed like grain on a threshing floor — what I have heard from the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel, I now pass on to you.

verses.kjv: The burden of Dumah. He calleth to me out of Seir, Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?
verses.web: The burden of Dumah. One calls to me out of Seir, “Watchman, what of the night? Watchman, what of the night?”
verses.ct: A message about Dumah: Someone calls out to me from Seir, "Watchman, how much longer until morning? Watchman, how much of the night is left?"

verses.kjv: The watchman said, The morning cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire, enquire ye: return, come.
verses.web: The watchman said, “The morning comes, and also the night. If you will inquire, inquire. Come back again.”
verses.ct: The watchman answered, "Morning is coming, but so is another night. If you want to ask again, come back and ask."

verses.kjv: The burden upon Arabia. In the forest in Arabia shall ye lodge, O ye travelling companies of Dedanim.
verses.web: The burden on Arabia. In the forest in Arabia you will lodge, you caravans of Dedanites.
verses.ct: A message about Arabia: You caravans of Dedanites will have to make camp in the thickets of the Arabian wilderness.

verses.kjv: The inhabitants of the land of Tema brought water to him that was thirsty, they prevented with their bread him that fled.
verses.web: They brought water to him who was thirsty. The inhabitants of the land of Tema met the fugitives with their bread.
verses.ct: The people of Tema brought water to the thirsty and met the refugees with food.

verses.kjv: For they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from the bent bow, and from the grievousness of war.
verses.web: For they fled away from the swords, from the drawn sword, from the bent bow, and from the heat of battle.
verses.ct: These refugees were fleeing from drawn swords, from bows ready to fire, and from the brutal violence of war.

verses.kjv: For thus hath the LORD said unto me, Within a year, according to the years of an hireling, and all the glory of Kedar shall fail:
verses.web: For the Lord said to me, “Within a year, as a worker bound by contract would count it, all the glory of Kedar will fail,
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Within exactly 1 year — counted precisely, the way a hired worker counts the days of a contract — all the glory of Kedar will come to an end.

verses.kjv: And the residue of the number of archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, shall be diminished: for the LORD God of Israel hath spoken it.
verses.web: and the residue of the number of the archers, the mighty men of the children of Kedar, will be few; for LORD, the God of Israel, has spoken it.”
verses.ct: The surviving archers, the warriors of Kedar, will be reduced to almost nothing." The LORD, the God of Israel, has spoken.
